intro: Tagetes corymbosa, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to yellow flowers and is often used in traditional medicine and as a natural pesticide. The plant has a strong, aromatic scent and is part of the Asteraceae family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and upright. Tagetes corymbosa is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its resistance to many pests.
